Comments_List: I learned much about a variety of religious and non-religious traditions and learned the importance of self-reflection/more about my values and beliefs as of this moment in my life.
Learned about answers to the question of what makes life worth living. Exceptionally interesting and practical class.
I was able to practice defending my beliefs which is inherently valuable
This course helped orient me and introduce me to key principles of various philosophies. It helped me understand how to think about key life questions and how to think about the decisions I make.

Strengths: the lectures each week from practitioners of the traditions we were studying were amazing. The readings were well chosen 
Weaknesses: sometimes it felt like the class discussions had no direction and ended up in debates on minutiae of the readings that had nothing to do with course questions
Miroslav Volf is a wonderman and the lectures by Matthew Croasmun were incredible.

This course was wonderful at introducing us to different philosophies. However, the limitation was that we examined principles in a bit of a silo. It would have been interesting to debate and compare/contrast philosophies more.
I would highly recommend this class.  Its material and structure is very different than any other course you could take at Yale.

Yes absolutely! This class is seriously trying to answer the question of your lifes meaning, and while it will probably take more than a semester to figure out the answer, spending this time is an excellent use of a semester.
Yes! This course was so helpful and interesting. It really was an important way to question our own principles and values and think about a framework to make decisions in life.
